description: the workers here are so nice! i have a close relationship with a few of the workers and they always know my order! 10/10
author: Elayna A.

description:
This Starbucks is located on the east side of Townsend near the intersection of Townsend and 8th street.  For as tight as San Francisco may seem this location has a lot more space inside but pretty much nothing outside as far as tables or chairs.  The inside is wide and open and has ample seating and tables for the amount of people hanging out doing the SB thing seems spacious however neighbors can be rather loud if on the phone etc.

Still for a place that's across the street at Zynga where all food and drink is pretty much given to all the employees this place is still lively enough with enough customers to be considered busy but with enough room during a weekday to accommodate people looking for a table and sit for a while.
author: Lambert P.

description: The last two times I've walked over to this Starbucks they've been out of the spinach feta wrap and that's the only reason I walked over.. pretty bummed out that they can't order their breakfast stuff accordingly..
author: Brandon M.

description:
This is our local Starbucks and it's quite busy due to all the companies and new residences popping up in the area. 

I'll give an 'A' for the staff who are consistent and have been there some time. It's easy to tell they work hard and keep the line moving at peak times. 

I'll only give three stars as it's Starbucks. I don't come here for it being a premium product. Instead, you know what your getting in a reasonable timeframe.
author: Matthew R.

description:
This is one of the best coffee shops in the Soma area of San Francisco if one needs a place to get some work done. The baristas are generally friendly and fine with you camping out for a few hours. With plenty of window and table seating, decent WiFi, and a few outlets, I frequently use it to get out of the apartment and act like I'm getting work done on my masters' coursework. 

The only downsides are that the music is often distractingly loud, the occasional homeless person making a scene, and that it's just another chain coffee shop without much character.
author: Clayton B.

description:
Pretty good coffee place

Located across the street from the Zynga office, this place is not bad. There are 2 washrooms inside that are reasonable clean. Lots of seats, with both tables and bar seats, and a large community table. The tables and seats are also kept clean.

In terms of the drinks, we got our coffee pretty fast. Tastes decent, like any other Starbucks coffee.

The wifi is fast and stable, so it makes this place a good place to sit down and do some work.

Overall, a decent coffee place.
author: Henry L.

description:
If you're looking for a study spot with plenty of tables and SPACE, this place is a fantastic Starbucks to study at.

The seating arrangements come in multiple varieties. There is the bar seating, the high stool round table seating, two-person table seating, cafeteria seating, and lounge chair seating at this location.

In addition to the spread out seating, at 5pm, this place still has plenty of room for you to choose your favorite spot.

The staff here is very kind, and is accommodating to your order.

Regarding the music choice, the calm jazz background music really brings out the coffee shop ambiance!

It will be difficult to find parking here, but there is a public parking garage nearby as well as some street parking. Do keep in mind that this store is on Townsend, which gets crowded during rush hour.

Bring a book, get a latte, and be productive!
author: L D.

description: You know what you're getting when you come here and on top of that, the staff here is always great. I don't drink coffee but their cold teas are great and what get me through the day. Even when you know the baristas have been going at it since 5am, they are always in a good mood when I get there at 9am. Hands down my favorite Starbucks in the city :)
author: Leina K.

description: Probably one of the better Starbucks locations in SF.  The interior is pretty big and has a decent amount of seating for those looking to get some work done.  There's even a kid-sized picnic table in the back too.  The drinks here were on par with other Starbucks locations, fairly quick too.  Of course, there were your usual crazy SF homeless walking inside or hanging nearby, but that's kind of to be expected in SF I suppose.
author: Bryson L.

description:
Good place to have coffee and snacks. 
The staff here are customer friendly 
I recommend these place to friends and family!
author: Ed P.

description:
I love spending my time here @ Starbucks since it close to my condo that I live @ and I love coming here for my
fav drinks since my BF Matt & Christopher always know my order and make it just right cause I love having something cold to drink and tea is my fav drink to drink while I am down here and me relaxing and chatting with my fav worker always make me feel great and relax and me having no stress a lot of these people that I got to know are awesome and caring worker I am glad to be near one that isn't too far away that me and my husband & my dad can come to when in need of a pick me up drink or food or both :D
author: Judy H.

description:
For some reason there are never enough employees in this Starbucks. It is really really close to my work (and about 10 tech companies in the area) so a rush in the morning and at lunch is to be expected, right? 
Otherwise, this Starbucks is clean. Like, really, really clean especially given the area and compared to every other dingy Starbucks in SF. A nice place with big tables, comfy chairs (WiFi) and typically only people coming in to get stuff to go so easy to find seating to do your work.
author: Kelsey B.

description: It was nice to be able to enjoy a refreshing nariño 70 cold brew shortly after gagging at the site of the tiling. Though the beverages were perfectly up to par, it was overpowered by the subpar lighting of the interior. This is the first Starbucks I have experienced with a bathroom code, but will certainly be the last. When I asked this barista, Caitlyn for the "code", she said sorry and went on her break. The real dealbreaker, ​however, was the furniture itself. How anyone could sit in those chairs is beyond me. Give me back my neighborhood Starbucks, ​please.
author: Eliza H.

description: I don't get the service here. 6 people ahead of us in line to order, and my friend asks for the bathroom code...Callyn, the barista, reprimanded him and said "once you make your purchase we'll give you a code" I get that Callyn has no social skills and has somewhat of a "God" complex since she's in charge of the espresso machine but her attitude was completely unnecessary. William, the cashier was kind enough to give us the code, before our receipt was printed.
author: John S.

description:
Fairly large Starbucks located on the south end of Townsend St, near the circle. This location seems to be a bit more relaxed than other city Starbucks', probably because it's off the beaten track. 

Parking can be tough during the day - watch the parking cops, they seem to frequent Townsend St!
author: Sebastian F.

description: I wish I could rate them higher as I visit the franchise all over the country daily. I stopped in 10 minutes prior to closing and only wanted an espresso. Unfortunately I was turned away. The staff had no intention making one - no sale while still open :(
author: Tom N.

description: Unfriendly cashier to start- then after forgetting to ask for a cup of water when my coffee and lunch were already purchased I had to ask for it twice, which was met with disdain, because filling that cup of water was "in line" behind 3 other coffees. Did I mention 3 people were standing around talking while the one woman was busting it filling the coffee orders?
author: Amber C.

description:
This one is directed at the cashier/barista named Christopher! 

Poor customer service and gave me the runaround for being a Gold Card Member. 

I purchased 2 drinks at this place. 1 tall cappuccino. and 1 grande extra hot latte. as a Gold Card member, I've never ran into issues regarding refills at any starbucks. This is the first time I got a runaround for asking a simple coffee refill. 

Anyways, here's what I happened... 

me: "Hi, I would like to refill coffee".

christopher: "sir, why are you refilling?" 

me: "uhm... I'm asking for a free refill (I'm a gold card holder)."

christopher: "I understand, but we cannot refill your coffee"

me: "why not?" 

christopher: "did you purchase coffee?"

me: holding two coffee cups... wondering if this guy is brain dead... I said, "well you see me holding the cups."

christopher: "your cups said you purchased latte and cappucino, we don't refill coffee on those purchases..."

me: "huh?"

christopher: "we only refill coffee if your original purchase is pike coffee"

me: "huh??? What I purchase is coffee although it's a espresso drink, it's still coffee. also these drinks are more expensive than your regular coffee. I've never had such an issue with a refill because I purchased espresso drinks. Not like i'm asking to refill a espresso."

christopher: "we'll we dont do that [smirk]" 

me: okay well, WTF! LOL

WHAT A HASSLE! SCREW YOU, there's another starbucks 2 blocks away. 

Here's a little more on free refills:
http://www.starbucksmelody.com/2013/01/06/the-refill-policy-clarified-starbucks/
author: Eric Y.

description: It's just a chain so it gets 3 stars by default but they handle the large crowds well and it's a spacious area. Service gets them the extra star. Baristas not as clueless as other locations.
author: Gonzalo S.

description:
Nice store, usually a good amount of people studying/reading/doing their thing.  The service is par - nothing special nothing awful.  Starbucks are becoming hard to yelp.

Good location.
author: Kevin J.

description: This place has the worst service! I ordered an egg sandwich and when I finished I asked for a water. The manager said only with a purchase. When I tried to point out the  girl I order from the manager cut me off and said only with purchase.
author: Mr R.

description:
Once of the nicest Starbucks I've been too.  Lots of room, plenty of seating.  There's even a book area in the back if you want some reading material while you kill time or whatever while you're here.

Came in with my kids, ordered a few breakfast items and let them watch a movie on my laptop since we were waiting for my husband and parents while they were at Suchada Thai Massage (around the corner).  I was paranoid since I've never sat in Starbucks to do anything other than homework, but the workers had no problem that the kiddos were watching Wreck-It-Ralph, a couple even made small talk with my kiddos about the movie.  

The girl at the register this morning was a bit on the timid side. very soft spoken.  When she asked for my name, I gave it to her and instead of asking how to spell it, she just replied, "I'm going to put Jean because that's easier."  ummm... ok.
author: Janina M.

description:
I wasn't able to find the little library that other reviews highlighted, which made me sad. My hunch is that it used to be the little nook with the child-size picnic table in the back, where the shelves are now stocked with merchandise. 

I came after the usual rush (around 4pm), where seating was aplenty and there was no line. I ordered my drink and discovered the mobile charging pads for the first time. Unfortunately, I could see very few wall charging outlets for my laptop. But I figured I might as well take advantage of the free power on (certain, not all) tables, and asked the barista how to use it. Without pausing in her potion-making, she kindly explained that I had to find one of the plastic rings hanging on the signs on the table. There would be one specifically for the USB port on my phone. And really, it's just that easy - take the color-coded charger (white for iPhone 5, the lightning port), then place the ring on the charging mat. There are some issues I already see with this: for people with bulky cases, you'll have to hold the ring in contact with the table to actually charge, and not all ports are supported. But that's not a Starbucks issue. 

Seating options abound. Love seats, window-side counters, personal tables, and communal workspaces all find a home here. There's a single bathroom stall in the back that smells faintly of urine. It's large, as are most Starbucks bathrooms, but a little less tended to. 

The employees here just seem downright helpful. Besides my own experience, another person was being personally helped by an employee who explained to her which items were on sale and helped her figure out the pricing on items one by one. Another also went around and politely warned us that they would be closing in 20 min. Verdict? A chill place to study in a nice area, if you avoid the peak times and have enough battery on your laptop.
author: Helen S.

description: My friend's second time having Cafe Mocha, my first time. My friend was like I promise you it tastes great. So we ordered two, the staff didn't ask us want it cold or hot, and just gave us the hot one which, my friend said, and I quote, why it is a hot drink, and it's much worse than the cold one. Why the staff didn't ask us? Feel disappointed.
author: Donna Z.

description: Clean and much more spacious than most Starbucks locations. Friendly, efficient staff. Good place to sit with your book, friend, laptop, or phone.
author: Yelper F.

description:
The bitter taste ain't from the coffee. 
After 3 weeks, multiple disappointing experiences.  No consistency.  Today's debate amongst themselves about a tall white was all over the place and I overheard it all; and it was my order.  

My daily walk is going to take me elsewhere.
author: Zane A.

description:
This is my regular Starbucks, due to the fact that I work in the building directly above it. They always make my drink correctly and I am usually greeted by a cheerful barista. Most of the employees are super nice and cheerful, and a few aren't. Abe is great, he always remembers my name which is a small thing but it shows he likes his job and is good at customer service. 

I also had an embarrassing mishap once with my debit card getting declined, and while the guy at the register was borderline rude about it, the barista (Mae I think her name was) came right up and told me not to worry about it because I'm in there nearly every day and the coffee was on the house. That's the kind of thing that will keep me coming back to a place. It was much appreciated!
author: Courtney Anne N.

description:
Normally I'm anti-Starbucks... I  prefer locally owned cafes and micro-batch roasted coffee. If that makes me a trendy, hipster, or coffee snob, so be it.

But this Starbucks has something going for it. It's open at 6am. There's a whole bunch of people who start working extra early and need a place to caffeine up and plug in earlier than later. Sometimes this is me... And it's a challenge to find a place open at 6am. The early morning crowd is a few professionals and a bunch of law enforcement. 

I still don't drink the coffee... Luckily they have tea, and most importantly an electrical plug and wi-fi at 6am.
author: Leona Z.

description:
I usually don't review Starbucks coffee shops but this one is an honorable mention! 

The decor is really nice with comfy upholstered chairs and a relaxing chaise lounge that fits my body perfectly! (I'm typing this review as I sit on it! Ha!) 

Service could improve a bit, but it seems like it was the guy's first day. My cappuccino was alright, guess I've been spoiled by Jane's version made with Four Barrel coffee (is it a crime to talk about other coffee brands while you're at St Bux?!?) 

There's a mini "library" near the counter area where you can grab a book and borrow it for a couple of hours. I like this St. Bux!
author: Janice C.

description:
Starbucks is such a spirit  filling area. It makes your forget the fact that your white. It really exceeds at giving you a diabetes in a cup coffee for your extravagant day of plying video games and mastrobating. The area itself is such a vibrant area of comfort that I almost forget to laugh at its breeding ground of reachets and shy white people (possible school shooters). In the end I will never get an experience like Starbucks can provide me.
(PS This may not be true)
author: Luis S.

description: Great Starbucks! They always make my order great and consistent. It gets busy here but you dont have to wait too long unlike other branches.
author: Kay M.

description: This Starbucks is nice inside. This is one of the best Starbucks in San Francisco. I don't like it that this location closes 3pm on Sunday. Other than that I like this location.
author: Isaac H.

description: This is my place to go the baristas are really good. They know their stuff well the morning crew Letty is the best!! . I've never gone in the afternoon though. Overall morning crew two thumbs up
author: Marjana S.

description: I love this location, it's a block away from my work.  Everyone's super friendly.  I love this location because it's part of my work routine.  A few of the baristas remember me, so it's just a great experience.
author: Rob M.

description: I've been coming to this Starbucks before going to work most days for the last 4 years and they have never missed a beat!  Everyone that works there is super friendly and are on a first name basis with most of their clientele, including myself.  I feel that this makes it feel more like a neighborhood coffee shop than just your average starbucks.  Kudos team!  You are what makes me keep coming back! :)
author: Alejandro R.

description:
Fair is fair.. I came back to this place to check it out..Writing a real bad review
And not giving it a second chance is moral wrong.. The new guy who open the place     
in the  morning is extremely nice down to earth and he took my order the way I wanted.. I always like to mix two different coffee  so I have my own blends..
author: Pedro D.

description: Super slow and quiet after work hours. This location is spacious and has plenty of tables/chairs to lounge or catch up with folks. I think this may be the only coffee spot around this area (could be wrong).
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Nicer part of SoMa. Spacious and not too crowded usually. Starbucks is Starbucks but I really like the interior design and the BiG windows! One of the better stores!
author: Jen K.

description:
Perfection in a cup.

I volunteer quite often for the Green Festival and when that happens, I need my first cup of caffeine way before hitting my post and schmoozing with visitors and fellow volunteers.  Never mind the cute boys manning the Equal Exchange booth nearby, they always had me covered with free cups of coffee.

This Starbucks is the perfect location in that despite it being in the center of a pretty busy area, it lacks the human severity others often face downtown:  cramped spaces, long lines, and impatient staff.

Not here.  They were friendly and accommodating, despite the mad rush of people and volunteers.  I ordered my usual Breve Latte, extra hot, and they had me on my way for the early shift.

Decent coffee, friendly staff, and a nice large room with comfy chairs to lounge in.
author: Miika M.

description:
Shout out to Lucille!! She's always so friendly and smiles, even when its at 430am! I've been coming to this Starbucks for a few years now, it's right across from my work. There's been times where I stopped coming for a few months, but as soon as I walk in for the first time in a while, I can always expect to see Lucille with a smile and ask me "Long time no see! Where have you been?". I love going by the bar to talk to her while she makes my drinks. It always starts off with - "I'm tired" "Mmmhmm girl, me too! I'll make yours strong today k? :)"

The staff here is always attentive, nice, friendly, and QUICK! They get through that line like its nothing! They ROCK!
author: Rosie W.

description: I always go here for a break to order my favorite coffee/tea. I also order my favorite pumpkin loaf cake. Unfortunately, when I came in this morning, I saw the lady putting in the pastries, and noticed a small fly eating the lemon loaf cake....gross...i told her about it...you know what she did, she just shoo the little fly away and still kept that lemon cake. Ugh! I am never going to order any more of their pastries. I swear!!!
author: Glenna C.

description: Its Starbucks....and a cute one at that! Nice baristas, good coffee....happy me!
author: Sarah J.

description:
I agree with the other Yelpers.  This is a great Starbucks.  It's off the beaten path in the Design district.  Huge sitting area with lots of tables and chairs.  Baristas are friendly and efficient.

Parking may be difficult depending on what's happening at the Concourse.
author: Shirley N.

description: This is my fav Starbucks!  All the baristas are super nice, plenty of seating, clean bathrooms, and I always get my drink with a smile.  The turnaround time for your drinks is also fast compared to other stores.
author: Elaine C.

description: Customer service is excellent! So helpful and sweet! I am studying and it was cold and he told me where to sit where the a.c isn't on blast! Also he was very helpful wht making my coffee the exact way I wanted it!!
author: Sara K.

description: This SBUX location is really nice inside, with a good set-up. Everyone seems cheery, including both workers and customers. It's a good sign when you see both. The iced coffee tasted better...4stars
author: Derek N.

description: I like this Starbucks more than most (and I come from Seattle, so I know what I'm talking about, trust me here). It's near where I work (when I visit the San Fran HQ) and the people are always friendly and the line moves quickly. Plenty of places to chill out and relax if you need to, and the seats are comfy.
author: Joshua B.

description: They must be African, because African love this place!!! Hands down the best starbucks/coffee shop in the state. Of course, the coffee itself is nothing to write home about (given its mass produced everywhere, but it does the job), but the people here make this place the best. I came here after a long tired trip from NY. Every single person in here was incredibly friendly and helpful, and you can tell they all enjoy working together. Their boss was walking around sorting things, and it was great to see the friendly back and forth they all had with each other. The place was impeccably clean, and everyone there was really down to earth and friendly. I ended up coming here every morning during my trip. I've been to many Starbucks, but whoever runs and works in this place knows what they're doing!! Great shops are built by great people!
author: J N.

description: Nestled in the interior design mecca for the 1%, this is one of those Starbucks where you can plop your laptop down and get hours of work and personal browsing done.  Everyone there is super nice, and the police presence there (the Highway Patrol HQ is right around the corner) means that you will have a safe cup of coffee.  Also, if you eavesdrop, you can hear start-up strategies and high-tech job interviews in the background.  I only wish they stayed open past 7, because it's not just about the Zynga employees and upscale interior designers offering to buy coffee for their uber-rich clients.
author: Khash C.

description:
I like this location a lot. It's far enough away from the center of the city that it's not packed... the employees are friendly... and it's pretty large for a city Starbucks. Doesn't hurt that one of the managers, TJ, is a total hottie.

Everything a coffee shop should be. But WHEN will Starbucks start offering free internet like EVERY other coffee shop in the Bay Area?
author: Sean B.

description: Another Starbucks location that warranted a review, simply for decor. I haven't been to that many in the city, but this stood out as one of the fanciest branches I've ever been too. Nicer decor than you'd find in most Starbucks (or cafes, even). Only minus was that they got my order wrong - I ordered a short, and was given (and charged for) a tall instead.
author: Johnny W.

description:
We were desperate 

We were thirsty

The non alcohol drinkers of the group needed caffeine before the game

Thank you!
author: Vicky T.

description:
UPDATE: I JUST FOUND OUT THAT THIS STARBUCKS CHARGES FOR WIFI? (they should call it WTFi) 
Are the 8-10 patrol cars/motorcyles there regularly all on break at the same time, all day?? (Me thinks not)
Perhaps they can protect and serve better if they were spread out, being the eyes and ears looking for unsavory characters who are up to no good instead of coffee clutching

So the message here is don't be marching in like a blazed up Brad Pitt from True Romance, lest the situation wind up like this
Cop eats pot brownies, Thinks he's dying http://youtube.com/watch?v=1IoCGpP1FSM

A little tidbit is that if you buy a bag of Starbucks you get a coffee for free. So when you run out of the mornin' goodness, you can walk downstairs, get instant gratification and squirrel that bag away for a rainy day (which seems to be everyday the last 2 wks)

Hmmm, Starbucks opens at 5am, right about the time they start concrete cutting across the street so I see a win win here
Police get all wired up on caffeine, pogo across the street and start ticketing Plant construction for constant early am and late pm noise violations, (see other review)
Popo fills tkt quota, I gets to sleep to a whopping 9
author: G K.

description:
When I go into a Starbucks, I know what I'm getting. Decent coffee with a hip atmosphere. I will always go with a Pete's over a Starbucks given a choice, but that isn't always the choice. I don't hate Starbucks coffee, it will do in a pinch. 
This particular Starbucks, however, is worse than that standard one. The coffee is on par, the staff is as friendly as always, the store is pretty spacious, but there is a lingering smell. This is about a half block down from where I work, so I frequent it and that smell is always there. I can't even describe the smell, but it isn't pleasant and that doesn't bode well for a place where I'm purchasing food items. 
However, I gave it 3 stars because apparently the smell isn't strong enough to make me not come back.
author: Scott C.

description:
Nice modern space.   The barista service would get full stars.  Friendly, attentive.  Did everything right.  You see a lot of police and parking patrol officers stopping in here.  Maybe a little louder than ideal, but sometimes that is just what I'd want.

But the WiFi was terrible the day I wrote this.  And I wasn't coming for the coffee, but for the place to sit down, and be on the laptop.  So now I've got an unnecessary coffee, in a place with non-functional WiFi.  4 stars.
author: Gregory D.

description: Terrible acoustics; loudest Starbucks I've experienced. Worse, the men's bathroom was dirty with paper and urine all over the floor. The windows at the street are filthy. Of course the coffee was fine and appreciated the WIFI and friendly staff.
author: John B.

description:
I love the decor in this Starbucks! Comfy seating, cute coffee tables and chairs with awesome artwork on the walls and a big-o window view at the front. I want to give props to whoever did the interior design for this place.

My only issue are the baristas, some days there are fantastic in both coffee brewing & customer service, then some days there are the ones with a smart ass attitude. Maybe they need a good ol' cup of pick me up?
author: Karen P.

description:
Wow, this place is faaaannnncccccaaaaaayyyyy (looking). I love it. I went here to escape from APE this past weekend and I was plesantly surprised by the amount of space there was in there. 

I also like the set up of it where the counter is separated from where they actually make the drinks so it's a well-defined space. Maybe one of those design firms made the layout for it. The bathrooms are also super nice as well. 

Im giving this place 5 stars purely on aesthetics. The drinks are the same as any other Starbucks, and the service was fine, but the look of it was superb!
author: Dustin H.

description:
Ok, on *occasion*, I cheat on my boyfriend Patisserie Philippe but ONLY because sometimes I just need some plain oatmeal for breakfast (when I'm taking a break from a merry macaroon morning). I somehow tell myself that ingesting some Starbucks oatmeal with brownsugar, mixed nuts and dried berries isn't somehow over 300 calories. And let's not get started on the Grande Vanilla Latte that always accompanies it...

Anyways, I dig this Starbucks because it's consistent good service, average food/drinks and A+ location (I live like upstairs). Nice little book shelf in back if you've forgotten to bring a book and need to kill time and it's got plenty of seating with not alot of weirdos (probably because we're in the middle of an office park). Overall, a good choice if you're going to consume mass-market food & bev.
author: Kori S.

description: Please wipe down the tables! Please do this on a regular basis. I brought a colleague here for an out-of-office meeting. There is dried, sticky coffee and crumbs on every table. It was pretty gross to be honest. No one working at this location was busy at this time, nor did they seem to care. We walked out.
author: Mason K.

description: Wow Starbucks is huge for a city Starbucks! Would love to read a good book here or do some hw. It's relatively not that busy! In front of zyanga. Clean and looks new wish I could have stayed longer!
author: Diane S.

description:
I decided to rate all the Starbuckses I have ever been to, so here I am.

Since I am from England, I must say this location was the first American Starbucks I had ever visited. It was back in 2008 when I was on a leisure trip to California starting from the north of the state to the south. It's funny, but I'm now thinking the coffee I got there was literally the first American drink I had on American land, since my plane arrived at 6am and on the way to the hotel I told the cab driver to stop immediately when I saw the Starbucks logo when passing by. Oh, I digress.
So, I've been to some European locations, and honestly they all look kind of the same, and this one wasn't way different, but the atmosphere was great. I guess it was because of the people, though, there weren't many of them early in the morning. What I saw was really nice staff, people looking busy as honey bees, giving a burst of energy to the whole cafeteria. This, perhaps, was my first touch to the real American people.
I got my usual caramel latte and the taste was quite the same as always, only it was served with really big smiles. I love the way people here always smile, and address you all the time with mister, miss, etc. It is nice, makes you feel special.

I know this isn't a real review, but this is how I felt it, and this is how I remember it. And since I had really good times in Cali, and this Starbucks was where it all started, there are these kind of romantic thoughts when I'm writing this, and they make me want to go again at the exact same Starbucks for a new adventure!
author: Marcy W.

description: It's so busy in the morning, but they keep the lines moving! I usually come here to grab a quick breakfast, but it seems like their toaster always leaves burned residue on my toasted food. Perhaps it's time for the staff to clean the toaster.
author: Amy G.

description: Placed my drink order & the cup never made it to the barista. I noticed my drink wasn't being made & asked him if he received my order & unfortunately it didn't reach him. With no hesitation another employee immediately gave me a voucher for any type / size drink on my next visit. I was extremely impressed & appreciative they think highly of their customers. Great customer service, thanks!
author: Steve W.

description: They have a serious ant problem.  I was deciding on which breakfast muffin I wanted and got quickly disgusted when I spotted ants crawling all over the food!!
author: J E.

description:
Love the mochas 
Best coffe shop yet
author: Jay P.

description:
I don't know what kinda dirty hippie they have running this place, but every time I go to this store they give me some random excuse as to why they don't carry the green plugs.

About 8 months ago they told me that Starbucks discontinued them since they created unnecessary waste.

A few month later they said that this particular store choose not to stock them because they felt they were unnecessary.

Today they said didn't have any. When I pressed them (now strictly for fun), the Barista said they would probably order some soon.

All in all this is a really good store. I just don't like being made to feel like I'm some heartless planet killer because I don't like to spill my coffee when I walk. I drive a hybrid dammit! on the east coast!!!
author: Adam L.

description: Never been a fan of Starbucks coffee but usually find their stores friendly enough. So when caffeine is badly needed, I'll dart in for an espresso, knowing what to expect (it won't be that great). But I don't expect to be actively and aggressively ignored by the person who is behind the counter. I lived in NYC for 12 years and in New York, you expect that, get used to, begin to like it. But here in SF, give me a break. You're from San Jose and you work in Starbucks. You can open your mouth, say hello and ask me what I want.
author: Brent H.

description:
This is a great Starbucks within the universe of a great company's set of stores. They are fast and friendly, plus accurate with the special quirks we think up to personalize our drinks. 

I admit, I am way way into the premium coffee gestalt. I like my coffee with half and half, no sugar. I prefer the darker roasts such as Italian, French and Sumatra. One thing I  learned is that the lighter blends like Breakfast Blend have more caffeine. The caffeine is roasted out of the beans the longer they are roasted. Counter intuitive, because the darker roasts taste so much stronger. Guess what? Caffeine has no taste. 

Love the seasonal drinks such as the Christmas Mint Mocha, Egg Nog Latte, Pumpkin Spice Latte (now being served, and the Easter time one which name now escapes me.
author: Betsy W.

description: The hours is incorrect. All I want is the sandwich, but they didn't even bother to come talk to me. I stood there for couple min. No one at least come over and asks me what I need. Horrible! Making me walk all the way there and telling me they are close at 5, 5,5pm!!
author: Tomoko g.

description:
Yes, ANOTHER Starbucks review....what can I say, I love my Charbucks.

But anyway, I went to this Starbucks yesterday for the first time....can we say bling?!  It's the nicest Starbucks I've ever been in by far (well, at least in this country!).  Really roomy, nice decor, and my drink was ready before I had my receipt!

Sadly it's not uber convenient unless you work for Sega....but I may try to figure out how I can go there more often.  Another plus is that it is very close to Patisserie Phillipe. :-)
author: Melanie N.

description:
This place is great. 
They were next to my office and they used to have my Grande Latte ready when I was about to pay for it. Very nice people, too bad Teala moved over to Berkeley (good for Berkeley :-) though. And you could feel safe because it was apparently the home office for the city cops... 
I still go there every now and then.
author: Kaj HeGe H.

description: COME ON PEOPLE! This is so sad... all this awesome independent coffee shops and ONLY the corporate america places have 5 stars?? Wtf is going on. Anyway, I have been coming to this StarBUcks for 4 years as its close to home and not to crowded. Its clean. I had to minus 2 stars because they used to have a childrens library in the corner but now its been replaced by more starsbucks gear for sale! Sad. I really liked knowing that I could come get my fix and my son could look at the books, reread the books he knows are there and just unwind for a moment. I minused another 2 stars for my experience yesterday. Came in around 330 or 4 and needed to refuel. Last time they messed up my drink, and although they fixed it, the made all the other peoeple drinks first! COME ON! Anyway, back to yesterday.. The dude that was cashiering has been there since march ( I think) and for whatever reason is just flat. I dont want to say anything else cause I am a lady however, I hate when I regular somewhere and they act like they could care less. PLEASE! I am not asking for special treatment, or anything like knowing my name, just a friendly hi or smile will do. Anyway, the coffee is starbucks. get out of your norm and support local business!
author: ashley n.

description:
As far as Starbuxen go, this is hands down the best one. The staff are really friendly and attentive and take true pride in their work. This especially holds true for Samantha, who is a barista extraordinaire. She remembers everyone's name and goes out of her way to make each customer feel warm and personally greeted. She really knows her coffee, and has an extensive vocabulary with which to discuss its subtle nuances. 

Normally I'm more of a fan of independently owned coffee shops, but as far as gigantic corporations go, I think Starbucks provides an excellent model that other companies should follow. And as far as Starbuxen go, this particular branch is the quintessential ideal.
author: Melinda K.

description:
I work across the street form this Starbucks so I go in quite often. Here are a few things i love about this particular establishment:

1. They always know me by name and remember my drink order
2. It is easily the cleanest Starbucks I've ever been to 
3. Even though this is a chain store it keeps a small coffee house feel thats very welcoming. 

I prefer to frequent independently owned coffee houses and I will continue to do so anyplace else. But this Starbucks has a customer for life. 

I'm giving it 5 stars for customer service and overall quality. If you are ever in this neighborhood go here and be nice to the baristas, they work their ass's off to make this place amazing.
author: Kim M.

description: I go here for lunch coffee. The staff is great.  They are kind and fix your drink to your liking.  The place is clean as well so its great when you just want to go online and chill.  Lots of nice looking girls go here too, not that that matters. haha
author: Nix L.

description:
...and I don't even particularly like Starbucks coffee. However, I live right above this one, so I always end up there. And I've gotta say, it's the coolest Starbucks I've been to. 

The place is pretty big. It has nice loungey chairs to sit on and chill. It has a flat screen TV that I wish would show something better than a random slideshow. It shows a little graphic of the artist, who's song is currently playing on the sound system. But I think they can get a bit more creative than that.

The cool thing is that they are the forefront of "Green" with their three options for disposing of items - Compostables, Recyclables, and Trash. 

The customer service is always amazing. Just the other day, they made an Ethiopian blend brewed in a French Press just for us. It took a bit longer than the drip coffee, but was totally worth it based on the taste! Rock on!

Needless to say, it's my local coffee shop now (yes, I cringe, as I don't usually prefer chain restaurants/cafes, but hey, what  can I say...they've proved themselves to me).
author: Samir P.

description:
good shop - convenient location...  like the decor and roomy...

also got $2 off my purchase with a promo from https://chowhour.com
author: tiger c.

description:
Alright, ladies!  The woman with red hair...five stars for customer service.  The girl with the little dreadlocks...is so darn cute!

Way to beat out the competition at Market and Church Safeway Starbucks.

---

Update:  the aforementioned red head found my beloved amex and locked it away in the store safe.  Three cheers for honesty!  Too bad I had already canceled it knowing that amex has an overnight shipment policy.  Either way, I am a happy camper when it comes to the 'bucks at 8th and townsend.
author: Becca A.

description:
Ok, ok, wait a minute. For all the Starbucks haters out there...I'm reviewing the human element of the purveyor, not the multi-national, megalomanical corporation, mm-kay?

With that said, I get my Carmel Machiatto here every morning and I don't even have to utter it anymore (btw, if I left spell-checking to the Yelp tool, I would be ordering a Caramel Machiavelli...go figure).  Anyway, this place is my caffeine Cheers. They know me, write my name on the cup and Voila! i am awake that morning!

Teala Alvord is a rockin' manager. She wears the black apron, you know. And I would be lying if I omitted that part of the reason I come here everyday is to see Starbucks' resident cutie-pie Anney. Not to say that the rest of the staff is not cute or friendly, she just stands out, is all.

I remember she was the first one to suggest that my morning bun be warmed up, and my mornings (and my buns) were never the same since.  That, and I love the daily trivia. Thank you for being in my neighborhood, Starbucks!*

*Sorry about that, shade-grown, free-trade coffee dudes...  :_(
author: Rey T.

description: Nice and roomy inside. Great place to study. Super Friendly staff.
author: Karen P.

description: I used to work for Starbucks. So I am a little biased. But this is a very spacious and quiet store if that is what you are looking for. Good stuff!!
author: Gregory D.

description: This new rollout of the la Boulangerie products sucks.I have been getting a daily Maple Oat Nut scone for years-I must have eaten 5,000- now they are gone forever. Who decided that all the old food products would be eliminated completely; they should have at least offered people a choice of old or new product.And the new rolls and cakes are tiny- the chocolate croissant is about half the size of a normaI one and costs a quarter more. I can only compare this to the rollout of New Coke, which was a complete disaster.Starbuck's really shot themselves in the foot with this bone-headed move. I see a lot fewer people lining up to buy pastries since this change.Something needs to change because they are losing customers quickly and I am one of them.
author: Jeffo C.

description:
A new Starbucks.  Shocking *haha*
Was a good place to meet a client and exchange cash for legal services.
Great place to cop-watch.  They apparently love this place, and coffee seems to keep them happy.
Was a larger one than many, but not huge (not talking about the cops anymore).
(Rumor has it that the staff at this Starbucks are lower eschelon, at least compared to the Starbucks around the corner at Kansas/16th.)
author: Today Y.

description: This starbucks location is one of my favorites! not just the fact that it's around the corner from where I live, which is a definite plus, but the workers here are super friendly and accommodating. It's a good size, not too big and not too small where you feel trapped in a coffee scented box. They get a good amount of foot traffic, but most of them take it to go so there's almost always an open table. Love This Place!
author: Melissa Y.

description: Great service, eye candy on the regular; so, you may ask what's keeping it from bringing the 5 home?! PO PO...that's right, 5-0, pigs, the fuzz...since WHEN did Starbucks become the new donut shop?! I'm not talking one or two, either; it looks like a regular Officers' Association Meeting just about every morning, & one or two afternoons...UGH!!!
author: Amoura B.

description: I dont even know how this place is open bad coffee watered down, bad service with a ba attitude ! Not a happy camper two thumbs down
author: John C.

description:
hi everyone! its yer friendly neighborhood starbucks manager!! lol
wanted to say thank you to all our fab customers that review us warmly and wanted to update some wifi info for customers who are (understandably) unhappy with having to pay for online service!
starbucks just signed a contract with at&t and will soon be switching from t-mobile to at&t for in store wifi. the good news..... anyone who registers a starbucks card gets free time in store! plus, all partners get free time daily too!! no set date yet, as you know all good things take time, but keep your ears open for free wifi at starbucks! its about time! yay
author: teala a.

description:
I love this location because it's not super busy like places downtown.  

Unlike Amoura B.'s review, I like the fact that there are so many policemen at this location.  SOMA can be sketchy in certain areas, and I feel really safe here.

There's a customer library where you can sit & read books.  They also take book donations.  The store is really big with lots of tables, chairs & sofas if you plan on staying a while.
author: Deborah K.

description:
i frequent this starbucks the most because its just down the street from my work, but i do enjoy it. enough that i will forego free peet's coffee in the company kitchen and get some new seasonal holiday drink explosion down the street. it helps that its not in the building (escape! success!).

the baristas here are really nice and friendly--often commenting on conversations between coworkers and me. Nice lounge chairs, and my favorite: a little library in the back. One of the most prominent displays: SCI FI!!! yay! even has snow crash and more neal stephenson and robert heinlein. very nice.

a word of caution: is a frequent haunt of the 5-0, in case you happen to carry illegal paraphernalia. just sayin'.
author: Jade L.

description: One of the nicer (and larger) Starbucks locations I have been to, this one has a cozier and more spacious feel.  It's a pretty new location and popular with the SFPD.  They even have books you can read while you're there and comfy upholstered chairs.  There are two bathrooms.  The place is very clean and the ambiance is warm and inviting.
author: Lolia S.

description: The standout difference for this Starbucks versus all the others in the world is that it is full of hot men coming in and out. I've tested it out, several times and so far on 5 separate trips, each lasting over 20 minutes, only hot men have come and gone from the premises. This leads me to believe that if you are a single girl (which I am not) you have some good odds here.
author: Denise B.

description: Oh hells yeah.  A clean, spacious SBUX right near my home.  After being up all night with the baby, I have a Red Bull for breakfast and the 'bucks for lunch.  Mmmm.  I'm on the Olsen twins post pregnancy diet.  The weight seems to be peeling right off!  Note:  The staff here is super friendly as well!
author: Poker B.

description: Wow a starbucks on the same block of work - how awesome is that!!!  I really love the staff Teala, Sam, Chad, Joelle, Rochelle - they all ROCK!!!!  That is what makes this Starbucks worth coming to everyday!
author: May A.

description:
The staff here are really nice, that's about all I can say.  

I mean, come on, Starbucks is Starbucks is Starbucks:  you know what you're getting, you know you're part of the problem, you know you're contributing to the sterilization of society, but what can you do?  You're addicted to coffee.
author: Patrick P.

description: Yah Starbucks is a chain and its quick. This one is pretty cool though. Me and my gf will go here to do work once in awhile. It's pretty spacious and feels like a bigger coffee shop where you can sit and talk or work away on your lap top. They even have a little library you can grab a book. The staff is all super friendly but not overly in your face which is a nice balance. Yes there are better coffee places but I have to say we always end up here. That and it's super close to where my gf's place.
author: Hyung L.

description: Fast service! They have a very clean bathroom (a big plus for me). But the AC could be turned down just a little bit.
author: Lisa L.

description: Coolest starbucks you will ever frequent.  Nice people work here and the ability to always get my drink without uttering a sound is always a bonus.
author: Blake S.

description: After the incident at Caffe Roma, I don't mind the longer walk to StarBucks.  I have always liked StarBZ and will always because their drinks taste so good.  It's nice to see that certain StarBZs have their own thing going on.  This one, for example, posts a question near the register and if you answer it correctly, you get a free drink!  They also write your name and the time you answered correctly.  Nice lounge chairs, and great service.  What more can you ask for?  Plus, NO FLIES in their drinks!
author: Michael B.

description: i have gone to TONS of starbucks in many cities, and this is the best one i have ever been to, they always seem to make everything perfectly right and EVERYBODy who works there is so fast and friendly and just plain nice. even the staff who gets there at like 4am, they are never grumpy or sleepy (i would be an angry person if i had to get there before the crack of dawn!!)... if you go there enough, they memorize your name and what you want and exactly how you like it too! they never mess up your order.. they're just great :)
author: Sofia M.

description: Believe the high ratings already posted. I've been to many-a-starbucks but this location is great because of the people working in it.
author: Mike J.

description: Great coffee, great staff!!  Honestly, that's all I'm asking for in a cafe.  There's no attitude when you walk in the door and they don't give you "that look" when you ask for something special.
author: M R.

description: I think this location is one of the best.. Three cheers for Samantha
author: Frank R.
